wikipedia_page.main:
This article is on the astronomer John Bolton.  For other people named "John Bolton," see John Bolton (disambiguation).

John Gatenby Bolton  (5 June 1922 – 6 July 1993) was a British-Australian astronomer.
Bolton's team at the CSIRO's Division of Radiophysics in 1949 was the first to identify radio sources as extragalactic, marking the beginning of extragalactic radio astronomy.
